title: Strictly's Anton Du Beke makes snarky response to Craig's 'fake teeth' jibe
text:

Anton Du Beke snarkily responded to Craig Revel Horwood's awkward jibe about his teeth at the weekend.

The professional dancer, 53, had dressed up as Austin Powers for the movie themed dance with Emma Barton.

When it came to the feedback from the judges, however, there was an incredibly awkward moment when Craig said that he had been distracted by Anton's wig and "fake teeth".

This prompted Craig to icily reply: "They're not fake by the way, they're all my own, dear."

This left host Tess Daly doubled over in hysterics while Craig looked completely mortified.

Anton and Emma appeared on It Takes Two today, during which he responded to Craig's cringey mishap.

(Image: BBC)

Branding it 'Toothgate', Zoe joked that Craig had loved his transformation "so much so" that he didn't realise that they were his own teeth.

"My orthodontist is furious, actually," Anton quipped. "I mean, the money it's cost me..."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Asked whether he had anything to say to Craig, he replied: "I've never trusted his eyesight over the years, quite frankly, and it just proves what we've all been thinking.

"Can't see past the end of the desk so I don't know why we're bothering."

(Image: BBC)

"I didn't think Tess was going to pull it back," Zoe quipped before joking that Rylan had left his dentist's number.

"I think they're called 'Sheer Veneers'," Zoe cheekily said.

They then mocked up a picture of Anton with a row of pearly whites photoshopped onto the image.

"Wow," Anton said, decidedly unimpressed.

*Strictly It Takes Two airs weekdays at 6.30pm on BBC Two
description: The professional dancer, 53, had dressed up as Austin Powers when Craig said that he had been distracted by his fake teeth - which turned to be real
